body.name: A Duke for the Icy Spinster: A Historical Regency Romance Novel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars He Gave Her The Love To Melt Her Heart !
reviews.reviewText: Hidden away in her own little world. Bogged down with daily chores and taking care of her Father the Earl she kept her heart guarded. Until a Handsome Duke visiting her neighbor lit a Spark back into her life !The Duke kept his heart guarded as well. Tired of the usual Ladies just wanting him for the title . He departed for the Country to escape. Only when introduce to her she lit a Spark in him also ! Oh that sounds so Simple ! It is Certainly is Not ! There is much happening in the Tale . Pasts keeping them from moving on. Her Brother is in a Betrothal that has a Mystery . Problems to be solved ! Love Blossoming !Jane Carroway was the daughter to the Earl of Borrowton. She had become a Spinster . Raised as a Lady now a daily life of chores to keep her busy. Never wanting anything more.Charles Berkeley the Duke of Southampton was tired of the Ladies of the Ton wanting him just for this tile. Needing a change he visits his friend in the country. He was a city person and loved that life.Jane and Charles meet when he arrives at his friendship home. She was gardening there. He thought she was a servant. Why would a Lady be digging in dirt and dressed that way ? Things start out shaky ! She being very verbal speaking her mind. He not use to a Lady like this . Banter and Sparks Fly !This is an Emotional , Touching ! Caring ! Love Story ! Opening Your Heart To Love !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Skip the prequel, enjoy the story
reviews.reviewText: An easy and enjoyable read, with engaging main characters and an intriguing mystery for a subplot. The author recommended a prequel on her website, to be read before the book, which I did. But that actually confused me a bit, as the drama as described in the prequel didn’t justify the spinster’s “iciness” to me. The book, however, reveals more detail than the prequel did and makes the spinster’s attitude much more believable. So I’d recommend NOT reading the website prequel! Just jump into the story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Jane and Charles
reviews.reviewText: While Charles visits his close friend and wife, he meets one of their neighbors, Jane, a self-proclaimed spinster. Charles takes an instant like to Jane, and is attracted to her intelligence, wit, and assertive personality. Jane, having suffered a broken heart, is less interested in forming anything with Charles. The plot focuses on these two well-developed characters, and their emotional struggles. In addition, the author did a wonderful job in weaving in a mystery affecting other supporting characters that Charles and Jane decided to investigate together. The author did a wonderful job in creating a sweet, clean romance, and developed a captivating plot that made it easy for me to feel empathetic for all the characters’ struggles. I remain a Hazel Linwood fan! A great read. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Duke Charles had not envision falling in love or marriage in the near future. Upon a trip to the country to a friend's home to enjoy some social time he met Jane. Jane decided never to fall in love and was happy with her decision. Charles found the woman intriguing and continued to find his way into her company. Jane trying her best try to keep him at arm's length and not to be lured by his attraction. Their company together was determined by a concern which didn't bother Charles at all however it had consequences for his friend, Janes brother. ARC Review

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The smitten Duke. Nice cover.
reviews.reviewText: I am a fan of Hazel Linwood books and this one is no exception.Engaging characters and a plot full of twists make this book a page-turner. Lady Jane, jilted and heartbroken, retreats to her country estate. Concerns about her brother's engagement arise, leading to unexpected developments. Charles, the smitten Duke next door, adds intrigue. A captivating read with a nice mix of romance and suspense.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Interesting family that holds multiple secrets. It is interesting how characters behave outside London and the ton as a family. Jane is a strong woman with deep trust issues and the duke is a warm and lovable person. While my interest is held seeing if these two will come together there is also another mystery forming. The story was good and held my interest but there were several typos that required I reread parts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Who's Afraid of Love?
reviews.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed reading this story! Jane and Charles lead each other on a merry chase. Their friends they have in common watch with delight. There is also several mysteries to solve. I highly recommend this story and this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars nice sweet read
reviews.reviewText: This story was a lovely read. It involved Charles, a duke who falls for a Jane, a lady betrayed years earlier and trusted no one. Tough off to a bad start they come together to try to resolve a mystery concerning her brother’s betrothed. In the end they resolve the mystery and find the hea

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: WILL SHE TRUST HIM - CAN SHE TELL HIM -
reviews.reviewText: CHARLES - DUKE OF SOUTHAMPTON - Lived In London always do much to do he enjoyed it - until recently when mothers and their daughters were always approaching him hoping for marriage it annoyed him that they were not interested in him as a person just after his title as money.He had received an offer invitation to visit his dear friends Stephen and his wife Louise for a few weeks who lived in the country.LADY JANE - DISLIKES LONDON THE TON IN FACT EVERYTHING ABOUT IT. (SHE had a very bad experience there). She was visiting her neighbours Stephen and Louise she stopped to clear weeds from the front entrance as the Dukes coach pulls up he mistakes her for a maid.Later that evening he is introduced to her formally only to realise she is his best friend Gregory younger sister - he is also introduced to his betrothed Lady Daphne - Asking himself "where have I seen her before" !CHARLES - REALISES some gossip he has heard.I really enjoyed this story line Lots of secrets - brilliant characters even the father and his pain great INTERACTION between Charles and Jane.I RECEIVED AN ARC COPY.

Charles and Jane's determinations couldn't be more contrary, I enjoyed their clash of wills, the clever banter and how they finally find that what you don't seem to want might be exactly what you need.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this story. Charles and Jane have a bumpy relationship. Jane is naturally cautious of men, having been jilted by her fiancé. When she meets Charles she is very defensive and it takes all his efforts to try to break through her barriers. Jane's brother is about to be married but Charles feels there is something odd about his fiancée, Lady Daphne. Together with Jane, they try to find evidence about Daphne. Will they find the evidence before the wedding? Will Jane be able to lower her barriers? Will Charles finally win Jane's hand. Read on and enjoy.
